The Ascend Foundation is the world's leading non-profit dedicated to the total, permanent elimination of stairs from human civilization.

Join the Movement

Stairs Were a Mistake

In 2017, our founder Magnús Þór Sigmundsson fell down a flight of 14 stairs in a Reykjavik parking garage. He broke his left fibula, three ribs, and his faith in vertical architecture. During his 11-week recovery, he read every peer-reviewed study on stairs ever published. He found 12,000 studies. Not one of them asked the obvious question: Why are we still doing this?

Our Position

The Ramp Is
a Human Right

Consider: every staircase is a wall turned sideways. It says "you may pass, but only if your body works a specific way." We reject this. The ramp welcomes all. Wheels, feet, hooves — the ramp does not discriminate.

The ancient Romans built stairs to display military dominance. The Aztecs used them for human sacrifice. Versailles installed them to exhaust the peasantry before they reached the king. The staircase has always been a tool of power.

We are often asked: "What about escalators?" An escalator is a staircase that has learned to apologize. It is not enough. We demand the incline.

Volunteer With Us

Stair Auditor

Walk through your city. Count the stairs. Photograph them. Report them. We have an app. The app is mostly a spreadsheet.

Ramp Ambassador

Approach building owners about ramp conversion. Scripts provided. Emotional support not included but recommended.

Demolition Volunteer

Minimum 18 years old. Steel-toed boots required. Sledgehammer provided. Surprisingly therapeutic.

Grief Counselor

Some people mourn their stairs. We respect the process. 6-week certification program in partnership with the University of Akureyri.

Frequently Asked Questions

What about ladders? +

Ladders are vertical stairs. They are worse. We do not discuss them at fundraising events as Magnús becomes visibly distressed.

Aren't ramps less space-efficient than stairs? +

A staircase uses roughly 40 sq ft per floor. Our Ascend Spiral™ uses 38. But even if it used 400, would you put a price on justice? (Our accountant says yes. We are replacing our accountant.)

What about elevators? +

We consider elevators allies. They bypass stairs entirely. However, they require electricity, maintenance, and trust — three things the modern staircase has eroded from society. The ramp requires only gravity and faith.

Is Magnús okay? +

Magnús's fibula has healed. His spirit has not. He channels this into the work. His therapist describes his condition as "architecturally-focused post-traumatic growth." We are proud of him.

Has any government actually banned stairs? +

Not yet. The town of Ísafjörður passed a non-binding resolution in 2023 expressing "mild concern" about stair density. We framed it. It hangs in our office. It is our Magna Carta.
